WRITING.TEXT: The tutorials that I like to follow are: 1) Narrated, no text at all and the teacher sound very dynamics 2) In the beginning tell the people: what are they gonna learn, what are the benefits of the subject you make tutorial on 3) I find more easy to follow the "Step by Step" tutorials and it's more engaging 4) Illustrated (if it applies) it keeps me engaged

WRITING.TITLE: We Go Where We Want To by jesus-at-art, 2013

WRITING.TEXT: nothing happens to it, it just stays there until you accumulate enough :) ... I don't like that system though :/

I don't think you'd be in any serious risk if you do not monetise your video ... just that maybe some of those actors or their production company would want to claim those video to be monetised for their own benefits, like those Disney fanart stuff that got claimed by Disney ... but you won't probably run into any problem if you just let them do it ... you might not even get under their radar ... those Disney fanarts stuff got hundreds of thousands of views before getting noticed.

WRITING.TITLE: Being right doesn't give anyone the right to do the wrong thing
WRITING.TEXT:
Many times, I've seen some people getting upset about the wrong doings of other people and go on another extreme to make up for it.
For example: it's wrong not to allow females to work/we need to have a gender balance everywhere... then the other extreme is: let's hire "anybody" for the work as long as they are female ...
Either extreme ends of spectrums are dangerous ... because it means that at some points it's gonna fall back into the other end again due to accumulated frustration, a cycle of endless retaliation and we will keep doing the wrong things over and over again...I'm really worried about this world but I also know that I am powerless so there is not need to ruin my health about it.
